in the Republic of Ireland. It is on the river Moy near the mouth of Killala bay. It is often used as a jumping point to the
and the west Mayo and south Sligo areas, however the town itself represents a fine base.
Ballina can be reached most easily from
airport which is located approximately 35 miles away via car. Trains also run from Dublin via a connection from the
line, the journey takes 4 hours. Train timetables are available online
Ballina is small enough to get around by foot.

value: content=One of the best salmon fishing locations in Europe.
content=Perfect at any time of year.
content=An excellent bar and restaurant located in the Quay area.
directions=In the center of town on Pearse St
directions=On O'Rahilly Street in the town center
content=Once a lovely old world pub. Now a good place for a decent home cooked meal.

There are no shortage of pubs located in Ballina and it is impossible not to find exactly what you are looking for.

value: content=An award winning bar, boasts an excellent restaurant and bar bites and a very busy weekend bar. The bar is comfortable and is divided into three sections, a front 'cosy' bar, which is older, a middle bar where you can talk (and be heard) over the music and a large back bar containing a small dance floor. Crockets is a modern and comfortable bar and despite winning all Ireland Dining Pub of the Year and the Traditional Pub of the Year awards, you will not find any traditional music.
content=A traditional fisherman's pub located beside the Ham bridge on Bridge Street. Friendly, quiet and relaxed - the pub boasts an working angling shop on the opposite side of the bar.
content=Family run bed and breakfast on the North County Mayo / West County Sligo border 5km from Ballina and close to the seaside resort of Enniscrone.
content=A charming 19th century estate on the Dublin road.
content=Long established hotel just on the outskirts of Ballina.
content=Cheaper inn accommodation, located on the Sligo road.
content=Centrally located on the banks of the river Moy near the town centre.
content=Small family pub with excellent live jazz by PJ and his resident band every Tuesday from 20:00.
